This photograph shows the 340 year-old Sessile oak tree "Chene Potel" prior to lumberwork as part of its felling, as it had not produced any new branches in Spring, therefore possibly dead, in the Foret de Berce, in Ju-pilles, northwestern France on Friday. It is 46 metres high, 105 centime-tres in diametre, and has 15 cubic metres of exceptionally high-quality timber. Furthermore, the "Clos" high forest, classified as a "Retirement Island" and covering 8 hectares, still boasts 300 trees. - AFP PHOTO
